title: Graph Based Shapes Representation and Recognition

author: Rashid Jalal Qureshi, François Rabelais University

segmentation: Passenger like crazy and I'm pissed you student in the University, France or play the two in France and I have a post representation this afternoon about graph based shape representation and recognition.
So we proposed representatives by graph that's denoted off the graph represent shape primitives like vectors and quadrilaterals, while describes the mutual primitive relations.
So we can see that the filled shapes after extracting the controls we vectorize the controllers and our attributed graph.
Each vector become the note of the graph and we also associate certain attributes.
For example, the relative length of the.
Vector became an attribute of the note and the relative angles between the two vectors became the attribute on the edges.
Similarly, the linear shapes are also represented by attributed graphs.
The only difference is that in case of linear shapes, lines are represented by quadrilaterals which are obtained by fusing the two vector having opposite direction.
Similar slopes and certain other critics.
So we represent shapes using attributed graph.

Once we have the graph based representation of shapes, we use a greedy algorithm to not to search exhaustively the search space, but to find the best mapping, and we propose a new similarity measure for for this, which is composed of three major parts.
These vertex to vertex similarity and extra similarity and splits as penalties, because this is a multivalent mapping, so we allowed to see it more than one graph.
More than one note in one graph together so.
Have you played this algorithm on filled shapes and linear shapes as well as hand drawn graphic symbols and the initial results are quite encouraging and.
Although I have not compared it with the other approaches using the skeleton based graph, but as far as the graphic symbols are concerned, we are at a very good end so.
We are so you are invited to have a detail inside of the approach used and I would like to have your valuable suggestions.
